TopicTitle: Anyoe else keep a fish tank?

Articles.Content: I was wondering, who else here keeps a fish tank as a hobby? I had a betta for three years before it died, and I have had a 14 gallon for a couple years as well.
I used to have a whole bunch of guppies, but over the years they died off. I don't have a tank any more.

I've got a big tank of water in my room that used to have fish in it, and is now just slowly evaporating.

The other day I realized that the plecostomus (almost got that right the first time ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) is still in there, alive and well. Oops.
I don't keep a fish tank, I keep 3. (maybe 4 soon)

> 
> The other day I realized that the plecostomus (almost got that right the first time ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) is still in there, alive and well. Oops.

So there is still *a* fish in there?

> 
> So there is still *a* fish in there?

Yeah... maybe I'll put it in the pond we made in the backyard.

> 
> Yeah... maybe I'll put it in the pond we made in the backyard.

How big is the tank?

I used to have fish, 40gal tank, freshwater. I had a number of native northern NJ species in it ([sunfish](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5d/Bluespotted_Sunfish.jpeg), [perch](http://www.fishinjersey.com/images/features/icefishing_feature_04.jpg), [crappie](http://www.onthewater.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/crappie-through-the-ice.jpg), and a few other things, complete with indigenous water plants. My cat got most of them. Didn't eat them, just liked to catch them and then drop them on the floor and watch them flop around. Nothing like coming home from work and finding a dried up desiccated fish on the floor. I eventually turned the tank into a terrarium, and kept a [5-lined Skink](http://www.fcps.edu/islandcreekes/ecology/Reptiles/Five-lined%20Skink/AR0165_1l.jpg) for a few years before giving him up to a friend of mine.

> 
> How big is the tank?

Ten gallons. Though I'd guess there are about 4.5 or 3.5 gallons in it right now.
